title: Justin Bieber begs fans to follow Savannah cats on Instagram as PETA blasts singer for designer pets
text:
He's so besotted with his very expensive exotic new kitties that he's even set up their own Instagram page.

And on Thursday, Justin Bieber begged his 119 million Instagram followers to follow his cats too as they lag behind with just 139,000 followers.

Not everyone is impressed, though, with animal rights group PETA calling out the Canadian pop star for 'fueling the dangerous demand for hybrid cats.'

Pet project: He's back in LA after his lavish second wedding to Hailey Baldwin in South Carolina and Justin Bieber has cat fever

He's their daddy: On Thursday, the singer, 25, begged his 119 million Instagram followers to follow an account dedicated to his two Savannah cats that he set up a week ago

Ahead of his second wedding to Hailey Baldwin this past Monday, Bieber, 25, set up an Instagram account for the kitties last weekend.

THR.com reported that he had splashed out $35,000 on the two Savannah cats, which are a hybrid of domestic feline and Serval, a cat native to sub-Saharan Africa.

According to the Savannah Cat Association, the animals are legally restricted or banned in a number of states in the US, but are allowed as pets in South Carolina and California.

In a statement to PageSix.com, PETA Senior Vice President Lisa Lange: 'Justin Bieber could inspire his fans around the world to save a life by adopting a cat from a local animal shelter — rather than fueling the dangerous demand for hybrid cats, contributing to the animal overpopulation crisis, and proving that when it comes to helping animals, his stance so far is ‘I don’t care.''

Say hi to Sushi: Bieber reportedly splashed out $35,000 on the two exotic kitties that are a hybrid of domestic feline and Serval, a cat native to sub-Saharan Africa

This is Tuna: According to the Savannah Cat Association, the animals are legally restricted or banned in a number of states in the US, but are allowed as pets in South Carolina and California

Criticized: In a statement to PageSix.com, PETA slammed the hitmaker: Justin Bieber could inspire his fans around the world to save a life by adopting a cat from a local animal shelter — rather than fueling the dangerous demand for hybrid cats'

Bieber started sharing photos of his news pets in mid-August.

According to The Hollywood Reporter, the singer purchased them from a specialist breeder in Illinois and they are more than 60 percent Serval.

The kitties, which he's named Sushi and Tuna, grow to just under two feet tall and can weigh up to 30 pounds.

Back in LA following his lavish second nuptials to the model, 22, at an exclusive resort in South Carolina, Bieber seems fixated on promoting the kitties.

Calling them 'my children,' he posted a screenshot of their Instagram page with the message 'Follow @kittysushiandtuna please.'

He's spent the past 24 hours posting a ton of photos of them on their account.

Fur babies: The kitties grow to just under two feet tall and can weigh up to 30 pounds. Bieber has spent the past 24 hours posting a ton of photos of them on their new Instagram account

Pet parents: He and Hailey exchanged vows in a religious ceremony one year after legally tying the knot at a New York courthouse and in addition to the kitties, they also have two dogs

Justin and Hailey first became pet parents together in December 2018 when they gifted themselves a tiny Yorkie mix they named Oscar for Christmas.

However, the Sorry hitmaker doesn't have a stellar record when it comes to his pets.

In December 2012, he simply handed over his hamster named PAC to a fan while signing autographs, telling her to 'take care' of it, TMZ reported at the time.

In 2013, he was given a Capuchin monkey named OG Malley by record producer Mally Mall.

He took it with him to Germany where officials at Munich Airport seized the small primate and quarantined it because Justin didn't have the right paperwork for the exotic pet, according to TMZ.

And in January 2017, TMZ reported the singer gave away his seven-month-old Chow puppy named Todd to one of his dancers claiming he was too busy to care for it.
description: 'Justin Bieber could inspire his fans around the world to save a life by adopting a cat from a local animal shelter - rather than fueling the dangerous demand for hybrid cats,' PETA said.
